attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

component.description: Captcha is a form validation component based on Recaptcha API.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Value of the component.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: An el expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component. When it's an EL expression, it's resolved to a converter instance. In case it's a static text, it must refer to a converter id.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: When set true, process validations logic is executed at apply request values phase for this component. Default is false.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Marks component as required.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: A method expression referring to a method validationg the input.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: A method binding expression referring to a method for handling a valuchangeevent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: Message to display when required field validation fails.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: Message to display when conversion fails.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: Message to display when validation fails.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: Theme of the captcha. Default is red.
attribute.name: theme

attribute.description: Key of the supported languages. Default is "en".
attribute.name: language

attribute.description: Position of the input element in the tabbing order.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: A localized user presentable name.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: Enables https support.
attribute.name: secure

component.description: Schedule provides an Outlook Calendar, iCal like JSF component to manage events. Schedule is highly customizable featuring various views (month, day, week), built-in I18N, drag-drop, resize, customizable event dialog and skinning.

attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a namingContainer.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An el expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: An org.primefaces.model.ScheduleModel instance representing the backed model.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Locale for localization, can be String or a java.util.Locale instance.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Ratio of calendar width to height, higher the value shorter the height is.
attribute.name: aspectRatio

attribute.description: The view type to use, possible values are 'month', 'agendaDay', 'agendaWeek', 'basicWeek', 'basicDay'. Default is month.
attribute.name: view

attribute.description: The initial date that is used when schedule loads. If ommitted, the schedule starts on the current date.
attribute.name: initialDate

attribute.description: Specifies inclusion Saturday/Sunday columns in any of the views. Default is true.
attribute.name: showWeekends

attribute.description: Style of the main container element of schedule.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Style class of the main container element of schedule.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: When true, events are draggable. Default is true.
attribute.name: draggable

attribute.description: When true, events are resizable. Default is true.
attribute.name: resizable

attribute.description: Specifies visibility of header content. Default is true.
attribute.name: showHeader

attribute.description: Content of left side of header. Default is "prev, next today"
attribute.name: leftHeaderTemplate

attribute.description: Content of center of header. Default is title.
attribute.name: centerHeaderTemplate

attribute.description: Content of right side of header. Default is "month, agendaWeek, agendaDay"
attribute.name: rightHeaderTemplate

attribute.description: Determines if all-day slot will be displayed in agendaWeek or agendaDay views. Default is true.
attribute.name: allDaySlot

attribute.description: Interval in minutes in an hour to create a slot. Default is 30.
attribute.name: slotMinutes

attribute.description: First hour to display in day view. Default is 6.
attribute.name: firstHour

attribute.description: Minimum time to display in a day view.
attribute.name: minTime

attribute.description: Maximum time to display in a day view.
attribute.name: maxTime

attribute.description: Determines the time-text that will be displayed on the vertical axis of the agenda views.
attribute.name: axisFormat

attribute.description: Determines the time-text that will be displayed on each event.
attribute.name: timeFormat

attribute.description: String or a java.util.TimeZone instance to specify the timezone used for date conversion, defaults to TimeZone.getDefault()
attribute.name: timeZone

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when a week number label is clicked.
attribute.name: weekNumberOnClick

attribute.description: Client side callback to execute when a date label is clicked.
attribute.name: dateOnClick
